official_title: A bill to reduce the amount of paperwork required by Federal agencies and to increase congressional awareness of the increase in paperwork required by bills and joint resolutions under consideration by Congress.

summary.text: Federal Paperwork Reduction Act of 1979 - Requires each Federal agency to reduce the paperwork burden such agency places upon business, the private sector and State and local government by a specified amount each year until fiscal year 1983. Directs that in such year such paperwork burden shall not exceed 65 percent of the paperwork required by Federal agencies of the private sector and State and local governments in fiscal year 1978. Limits the budget authorizations of any agency which fails to meet the annual reduction quotas established by this Act. Requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to review and report to Congress on the progress of agency paperwork reduction programs. Amends the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1970 to require all public legislation reported by any congressional committee to be accompanied by a Paperwork Impact Statement detailing the paperwork burden which would be imposed upon business, the private sector, and State and local governments by such legislation.
